p: A new conceptual model for PD pathogenesis proposed by Johnson et al., in which disease-associated factors are divided into three categories: triggers, facilitators, and aggravators, describes in an elegant manner a multifactorial etiology of PD [ 140]. Based on this model, pharmacological therapies aiming at slowing or arresting PD progression should not only be given to patients enriched for the appropriate target, but also be administered in the relevant phases of the disease [ 140].
